alert.note: Alert for Dyer (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 07 at 3:38PM CDT until June 07 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of West Tennessee, including the following county, Dyer. * WHEN...Until 645 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 338 PM CDT, trained weather spotters reported minor street flooding in the Dyersburg area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen in the past couple of hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dyersburg, Newbern, Bradleytown, Jenkinsville, Nauvoo, South Dyersburg, Evansville, Middle City, Viar, Millsfield, Bishop, Maxey, Finley, Roellen, Lenox, Parker, Big Boy Junction, Rohoboth, Edgewood and Mengelwood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
